reviews.review_msg: Dr. K is the analogy queen. She makes you understand.
Do not take, wait for another teacher to teach the class. If not, look for other class alternatives.

Honestly, if you get your money's worth from tuition and actually attend her lectures, she'll tend to *really* emphasize certain things that are examinable. There is a LOT of material in this course, so I can kinda see why she can sometimes seem rushed, but she was very approachable after lecture and really good at clarifying things I didn't get

I had Dr K for 229 and 222. She's the best prof i have had in MBB. Go to lectures and go to office hours. She can seem intimidating at first but she's so knowledgable in her field and soooo helpful if you just go and ask. Can not wait for 309 with her. Take her courses!
She is the best prof I've had in mbb. Go to office hours. Tells you whats on exams if you go to lecture. Take her courses!

Tbh she's not bad. Just really have to memorize every key detail of each lecture. Exams make are entirely your grade so do your best on the first two midterms. Final exam is not culumative even tho she says it is! Focus on the last few lectures and you should be ok.

Lecture slides are very text heavy yet do not have most of the important information on them (she will make additional notes on slides which you will not have access to). She does not record lectures or let you have your phone out to record lectures. So if you miss a day, you miss all the important information. Exams are VERY specific.

MBB courses are content heavy no matter what. I think some people just did not want to put in the work and that's why they did not like this class. Dr. K was fairly clear in explanations and about what was important, however, her lecture slides were crammed with information towards the end. Textbook was recommended but I did not use it much.

I enjoyed 222. Just need to go into the class with the understanding that it is a really heavy course. Really dense, detail-oriented, and full course that takes consistent studying. Put in the work and youll do well. I found her lecture notes to be really useful, only used the textbook a handful of times when I needed clarification. Good office hrs

Her slides were a mix of pictures with some text heavy slides like paragraphs and would just tell us to read it ourselves. She moves at a very fast pace. I mostly self taught myself with youtube videos because a lot of what she said and in the slides were just not detailed enough to understand. She explains it like you know the topics prior.

Awesome proff IF you put in the work. Its a dense course. Go to lecture she tells you what is on the exams. Super helpful in office hours. Don't expect to do well if you dont go to class. Would take again.

I thought that Irinia was decent.. She grades pretty difficult and is specific with her answers. With that said, I give her the benefit of the doubt. This is a VERY dense course with a lot to go over. You dont have the time to coast nor assume things are gonna be easy lol because they wont be. She gave me a good grade so I cant complain much though
Avoid at all cost! garbage prof! Boring and heavy lecture and she does not give a F about the students.

This prof says cumulative final then makes it not cumulative and makes readings required when the textbook is very expensive but the free version we find has very bad formatting. tutorials are mandatory and i had bad experience with the TAs as well. her lecture is very boring and hard to focus on, you can catch many people sleeping.

Irina's a good prof. Not bad but not great, she does her job and helps students do it decently well. MBB222 is a really dense and heavy course, so there's, unfortunately, no way around that. Lectures are really heavy and feel like they lag on forever because of it. I would take another class with her again, but I wouldn't necessarily seek her out
